milestones.name: First Steps in German
milestones.description: After completing this unit, students will be able to greet people appropriately, introduce themselves with their name and age, understand the German alphabet for spelling purposes, count to twenty, and use basic politeness expressions in simple conversations.

milestones.name: Me and My World
milestones.description: After completing this unit, students will be able to introduce themselves and others with essential personal information including name, age, nationality, family, appearance, and living situation. They can ask and answer simple questions about personal details and engage in basic getting-to-know-you conversations using the verbs sein and haben with confidence.

milestones.name: Home and Daily Life
milestones.description: After completing this unit, students will be able to describe their living space, talk about furniture and household items, express daily activities using present tense verbs, tell time, and describe their daily routine from morning to evening using appropriate time expressions.

milestones.name: Food and Shopping
milestones.description: After completing this unit, students will be able to name common foods and drinks, order meals in restaurants, identify different types of shops, ask about prices using numbers up to 100, and conduct basic shopping conversations using the modal verb können to express ability and possibility.

milestones.name: Getting Around Town
milestones.description: After completing this unit, students will be able to navigate a German town using public transportation, ask for and give basic directions, discuss weather conditions that affect travel, and describe their daily routes around town using appropriate vocabulary and grammar structures.

milestones.name: Talking About the Past
milestones.description: After completing this unit, students will be able to describe past events and experiences using the Perfekt tense with both haben and sein auxiliaries, ask and answer questions about past activities, and tell simple stories about holidays, weekends, and personal experiences using appropriate time expressions and sequence connectors.

milestones.name: Health and Body
milestones.description: After completing this unit, students will be able to describe health problems, participate in basic medical conversations, understand simple medical advice, and discuss healthy lifestyle choices using modal verbs müssen and sollen.

milestones.name: Work and Future Plans
milestones.description: After completing this unit, students will be able to describe their current job or studies, talk about workplace activities and routines, express future plans and career goals using basic future tense, and discuss job preferences and abilities using modal verbs.

milestones.name: Travel and Experiences
milestones.description: After completing this unit, students will be able to plan trips, make hotel reservations, describe and compare places they have visited, narrate past travel experiences, and give recommendations to other travelers using appropriate past tenses and comparative forms.

milestones.name: Relationships and Communication
milestones.description: After completing this unit, students will be able to describe family members and relationships, make phone calls and appointments, express opinions with reasons using conjunctions, and engage in conversations about personal relationships and communication needs.

milestones.name: Culture and Free Time
milestones.description: After completing this unit, students will be able to discuss their hobbies and cultural interests, make and respond to invitations, express preferences and opinions about entertainment, and engage in natural conversations about planning free time activities using past, present, and future tenses appropriately.

milestones.name: Education and Learning
milestones.description: After completing this unit, students will be able to discuss various aspects of education systems, express complex opinions about learning methods, use subjunctive II for hypothetical situations and polite suggestions, and participate in discussions about educational experiences and policies using appropriate academic vocabulary.

milestones.name: Media and Information
milestones.description: After completing this unit, students will be able to understand various types of media, use passive voice and reported speech structures, discuss media influence on society, and evaluate information sources critically.

milestones.name: Environment and Sustainability
milestones.description: After completing this unit, students will be able to discuss environmental problems and their causes, express opinions about sustainability measures, suggest solutions to environmental issues, describe their personal environmental habits, and discuss future environmental scenarios using appropriate vocabulary and complex grammatical structures.

milestones.name: Personal Growth and Goals
milestones.description: After completing this unit, students will be able to express their personal goals and ambitions, discuss hypothetical situations, give advice using conditional forms, and engage in conversations about personal development and life planning.

milestones.name: Work and Professional Life
milestones.description: After completing this unit, students will be able to navigate professional situations in German, write formal job applications and business correspondence, participate confidently in workplace conversations and interviews, and discuss their career goals and professional development plans.

milestones.name: Society and Current Events
milestones.description: After completing this unit, students will be able to read news articles, express complex opinions about social issues, discuss current events with supporting arguments, and participate in conversations about technology's impact on society using advanced grammatical structures including relative clauses, passive voice, and complex conjunctions.

milestones.name: Global Issues and Perspectives
milestones.description: After completing this unit, students will be able to understand and discuss complex global issues, express sophisticated opinions about international relations and cultural perspectives, use advanced grammatical structures for formal and academic discourse, and demonstrate the language skills needed for B2-level interaction with native speakers on topics of global significance.

milestones.name: Science and Innovation
milestones.description: After completing this unit, students will be able to understand and discuss scientific research methods, describe technological innovations, read academic texts about science, express opinions on ethical issues in science and technology, and engage in sophisticated discussions about the future of scientific development using appropriate formal register and complex grammatical structures.

milestones.name: Arts and Cultural Expression
milestones.description: After completing this unit, students will be able to discuss various art forms using sophisticated vocabulary, write detailed cultural critiques, report artistic opinions using Subjunctive I, and engage in nuanced debates about cultural and artistic topics at an advanced intermediate level.

milestones.name: Economics and Business
milestones.description: After completing this unit, students will be able to understand complex economic texts, discuss business strategies using sophisticated language structures, analyze market data, and engage in detailed conversations about economic policies and international trade using advanced German grammar patterns including third conditionals, subjunctive mood, and complex argumentation structures.

milestones.name: Politics and Governance
milestones.description: After completing this unit, students will be able to engage confidently in political discourse, express and defend complex political opinions, analyze governmental processes and policies, and participate effectively in formal political discussions and debates.

milestones.name: Philosophy and Ethics
milestones.description: After completing this unit, students will be able to engage in sophisticated philosophical discussions, analyze complex ethical dilemmas, debate abstract concepts with nuanced argumentation, and synthesize philosophical frameworks to address real-world moral questions.

milestones.name: Academic Discourse
milestones.description: After completing this unit, students will be able to engage confidently in academic discourse, write scholarly texts with appropriate register and precision, present research findings clearly, and participate effectively in academic discussions using hedging, critical analysis, and sophisticated argumentation strategies.

milestones.name: Professional Communication
milestones.description: After completing this unit, students will be able to communicate with executive-level sophistication in German business environments, deliver persuasive presentations, negotiate effectively, write professional documents with appropriate register, and navigate cross-cultural business situations with confidence and cultural sensitivity.

milestones.name: Complex Social Analysis
milestones.description: After completing this unit, students will be able to analyze complex sociological phenomena using sophisticated German, evaluate social policies critically, discuss demographic trends and social inequality with academic precision, and produce detailed analyses of societal transformations using near-native fluency and stylistic variation.

milestones.name: Literary and Artistic Criticism
milestones.description: After completing this unit, students will be able to analyze literary and artistic works using sophisticated critical frameworks, express nuanced aesthetic judgments, engage with theoretical concepts, and produce well-structured critical writing that demonstrates advanced command of German academic register and argumentation techniques.

milestones.name: Advanced Problem Solving
milestones.description: After completing this unit, students will be able to analyze complex problems systematically using sophisticated analytical frameworks, facilitate high-level problem-solving discussions with native-like fluency, implement innovative solutions using advanced linguistic structures, and demonstrate near-native competency in academic and professional problem-solving contexts.

milestones.name: Specialized Knowledge Domains
milestones.description: After completing this unit, students will be able to communicate effectively in highly specialized professional and academic contexts, navigate complex domain-specific terminology across multiple fields, and synthesize information from various specialized sources to facilitate expert-level interdisciplinary dialogue and decision-making.

milestones.name: Native-like Fluency
milestones.description: After completing this unit, students will have achieved true native-like fluency in German, with mastery of idiomatic expressions, cultural nuances, regional variations, and perfect pronunciation, enabling them to communicate naturally and appropriately in any German-speaking context.

milestones.name: Sophisticated Written Expression
milestones.description: After completing this unit, students will be able to produce sophisticated written texts across multiple genres, demonstrating native-like control of style, register, and rhetorical devices. They will master literary writing techniques, journalistic style, persuasive rhetoric, and can adapt their writing seamlessly for any audience or purpose.

milestones.name: Complex Oral Communication
milestones.description: After completing this unit, students will be able to deliver sophisticated presentations and engage in complex debates with native-like fluency, employing advanced rhetorical techniques, humor, and masterful discourse management to communicate with precision and impact across all professional and academic contexts.

milestones.name: Cultural and Historical Analysis
milestones.description: After completing this unit, students will be able to conduct sophisticated cultural and historical analysis using advanced German academic discourse, critically evaluate historical sources and cultural artifacts, apply interdisciplinary methodologies to complex cultural questions, and demonstrate native-like proficiency in discussing abstract historical and cultural concepts with nuanced precision.

milestones.name: Mastery Integration
milestones.description: After completing this unit, students will be able to demonstrate complete mastery of German at a native speaker level, switching effortlessly between all registers and styles, expressing themselves with complete naturalness and precision in any situation, and demonstrating full cultural and linguistic competence equivalent to an educated native speaker.
